TopicTitle: Maybe the most kerbal idea I have heard of

Articles.Content:
So, there is an organization thinking of sending humans to mars but not get them back.

Here is an article from the CNN: http://edition.cnn.com/2013/04/22/world/mars-one-way-ticket

And here is the organization's site: http://applicants.mars-one.com/
In the timespan they will spend there technology would be ready for a return trip if necessary, especially if the rocket doesn't have to support a crew on the way to Mars.
As long as there is food, potable water, adequate shelter, long-term life support system, and strong internet connection, I'm pretty sure that the participants won't request a return trip anymore.
A Mars return involves a Mars launch, plus lots of fuel taken there specifically for the launch, plus launching installations. Plus, if the objective is having a Mars colony, why bother?

In the timespan they will spend there technology would be ready for a return trip if necessary, especially if the rocket doesn't have to support a crew on the way to Mars.

Offtopic - Your Signature scared me.

Ontopic - I'm not going there, i like Terra.
Imagine having second thoughts half way there lol.

and strong internet connection,

People now complain if they have a 300 millisecond ping. Imagine how much people would complain about a 180,000 to 1,320,000 ms ping time....
Mars one is a big scam. I highly doubt that M1 is capable of acquiring the funding needed for the mission.

I don't know, I reckon it's a reasonable idea. We know more than the average guy how much more complex return missions can be.

I've been following them on Facebook, anyway.

The sad part is that nasa had a NERVA drop in for the Saturn V 3rd stage that would be larger though lighter allowing for enough delta V for mars missions to begin in the late 60's. Then the budget got slashed.
